newsitem.title: HUNGARY: FORINT ENDS STEADY AFTER REVERSAL OF EARLY RALLY.
newsitem.headline: FORINT ENDS STEADY AFTER REVERSAL OF EARLY RALLY.

text.p: A pause in dollar-buying temporarily moved the forint towards the central bank's resistance level but renewed dollar interest in the afternoon caused it to fall back to its opening level, dealers said.
The forint finished some 40 pips below the bid at 158.00/05 to one dollar after strengthening from its 157.90/158.00 opening to the 157.60 level in early trade.
"I think some players anticipated an end to the (dollar-buying) trend today but some big banks began buying again in the afternoon," said Peter Benda of Citibank.
